item.title: Blue and gold
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“naseem142, post:11, topic:550288”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=669200.msg4475009#msg4475009 date=1425224746]

God, really. This was the last place I expected this to show up.

I didn’t watch the video. But here’s the explanation:
LIGHT CHANGES SHIT.

That doesn’t explain why some people see it the wrong way (White and gold), while the rest is perfectly normal and sees it as blue and black.
The simple explanation is that the picture is in an unambiguous context. People doesn’t interpret the lighting condition the same and thus sees it as different colours.

It’s supposed to be a dress for a wedding. Explain to me why it’s wrong to see it white and gold (traditional wedding colours) and why it’s right to see the dress in blue and black.
[/quote]

What are the colors you see? just to be sure , be honest[/quote]
White and gold.

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:12, topic:550288”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=669200.msg4475009#msg4475009 date=1425224746]
It’s supposed to be a dress for a wedding. Explain to me why it’s wrong to see it white and gold (traditional wedding colours) and why it’s right to see the dress in blue and black.
[/quote]
I was just joking.[/quote]
-.-

Read full topic

item.title: Blue and gold
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

This is not about how we see colour, but about how we interpret the lighting condition. If you you see it as white you think it is in a shadow, if you see it as blue you think it is brightly lit.
Take out a portion on of the picture of a single colour and everyone will see it as the same colour.

Read full topic

item.title: Blue and gold
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:5, topic:550288”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=669200.msg4474935#msg4474935 date=1425177238]
God, really. This was the last place I expected this to show up.
[/quote]You serious?[/quote]
Figured the forums were dead enough this wouldn’t come here.

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:6, topic:550288”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=669200.msg4474935#msg4474935 date=1425177238]
God, really. This was the last place I expected this to show up.

I didn’t watch the video. But here’s the explanation:
LIGHT CHANGES SHIT.
[/quote]
That doesn’t explain why some people see it the wrong way (White and gold), while the rest is perfectly normal and sees it as blue and black.
The simple explanation is that the picture is in an unambiguous context. People doesn’t interpret the lighting condition the same and thus sees it as different colours. [/quote]
Everyone perceives light differently.
What I may see as light blue you might see as sky blue.
Or what I might see as white you might interpret as a light shade of gray.
So when someone said white, they could have easily meant “light blue”, because I could see the two getting mixed up.

I’m not a scientist and I don’t study neurology or the eyes, so I cannot be very specific. But based on my limited knowledge, light, along with something like the placebo effect, had a huge factor here.

When I say placebo effect, I mean because someone reads “I see this as white and gold” so their mind tricks them into thinking it’s white and gold.

Read full topic
